availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph R. Bodine (Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Alfred Bodine and Fannie Bodine. Married to Gertrude Terrell Bodine in Nelson County in August 1862. Father of Archibald Bodine and Alfred Bodine. Student in Nelson County in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1850. Farmer in Nelson County in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 287A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 7.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 258.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, District 1, p. 125A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County, Fairfield, p. 136B-137A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, Film #000500449, p. 412.
Find A Grave, "Joseph R. Bodine (unknown-1870)," Memorial #214201440, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/214201440/joseph-r-bodine (accessed August 14, 2020).
